Italy: Battle of Barbalissos: A Sasanian force destroyed a Roman army at Barbalissos. Gallus and Volusianus were killed in a mutiny at Terni. The army acclaimed Aemilianus, governor of Pannonia and Moesia, ruler of Rome. Aemilianus was killed by his own soldiers in the face of the army of the general Valerian (emperor). Valerian gave his son Gallienus the title Caesar.
